title: King’s Arms Tavern Chutney Salad Dressing
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon freshly ground pepper (preferably white)
¼ cup Mango Chutney; bottled Major Gray’s Chutney, finely chopped
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, mustard, salt, and pepper until the salt is dissolved then stir in the chutney.  Add the oil in a slow, steady stream, whisking constantly, until the dressing is thick and emulsified.
The dressing keeps, if tightly covered, in the refrigerator for up to one week.
source: The Colonial Williamsburg Tavern Cookbook, by The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation, Recipes Developed by John R. Gonzales, Edited by Charles Pierce, Clarkson Potter/Publishers, New York, © 2001 by The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation.
